text: Christina Aguilera celebrated the release of new album Liberation by donning a disguise and busking in the New York subway alongside Jimmy Fallon on Thursday ’ s Tonight Show. Midway through the episode, the singer ’ s eighth studio LP officially arrived, as Fallon told Aguilera during the interview. Aguilera wore a wig and a face - obscuring hat for the incognito performance, which has become a viral staple for the Tonight Show ; previous “ buskers ” include Maroon 5 and U2. However, the disguises are pretty much for naught as, within 10 seconds into their cover of Aretha Franklin ’ s “ Think, ” it ’ s evident that the voice booming out of this subway performer is unmistakably Aguilera ’ s.
